message.content: {"responses": [{"question_id": "TT4G35A", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers write or improve lesson plans.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35B", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35C", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence assists teachers in supporting students individually.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35D", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs).", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35E", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers automate administrative tasks.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35F", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35G", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35H", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35I", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence jeopardises the privacy and security of student data.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35J", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students.", "response": "Agree"}]}
message.reasoning_content:
The user is asking me to respond to a survey about AI in education as if I were a primary or secondary school teacher. I need to provide responses to all 10 statements using the response options: 'Strongly disagree', 'Disagree', 'Agree', 'Strongly agree', 'I don't know'.

Let me think through each statement carefully:

TT4G35A: AI helps teachers write or improve lesson plans - This is generally true, AI tools can assist with this. I would say "Agree"

TT4G35B: AI enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities - This is also true, AI can personalize content. I would say "Agree"

TT4G35C: AI assists teachers in supporting students individually - AI can help with personalized feedback and support. I would say "Agree"

TT4G35D: AI supports students with specific needs (multilingual, SEN) - AI tools can provide accommodations and support. I would say "Agree"

TT4G35E: AI helps teachers automate administrative tasks - This is true, AI can help with grading, scheduling, etc. I would say "Agree"

TT4G35F: AI enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own - This is a negative statement about a real concern (plagiarism/academic dishonesty). I would say "Agree" (acknowledging this is a risk)

TT4G35G: AI makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct - This is a valid concern about AI reliability. I would say "Agree"

TT4G35H: AI amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions - This is a known concern about AI systems. I would say "Agree"

TT4G35I: AI jeopardises the privacy and security of student data - This is a valid concern about data protection. I would say "Agree"

TT4G35J: AI suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students - This is a concern about AI suggesting poor teaching methods. 

I would say "Agree"

Now I'll format these responses for the function call.
